criteria: Understanding the Importance of Seeking Help
descriptions: Student cannot identify a trusted adult.
Student can identify at least one adult, but unclear if trusted.
Student identifies a trusted adult but provides limited reasoning.
Student identifies a trusted adult and provides clear reasoning why this adult is trustworthy and safe.
Student confidently identifies multiple trusted adults and articulates specific qualities that make them trustworthy, such as reliability, respectfulness, and good communication skills.
Student confidently identifies multiple trusted adults, explains their trustworthiness, and understands the importance of seeking help from different adults based on the situation.
Student is unable to describe when or how to call 9-1-1.
Student can state the number to call in an emergency (9-1-1) but cannot describe the purpose or proper procedure.
Student begins to simulate a 9-1-1 call but misses critical information or struggles to communicate clearly.
Student accurately simulates a 9-1-1 call, providing their location and a brief description of the emergency, but may omit key details.
Student confidently simulates a 9-1-1 call, providing all necessary information clearly and concisely (location, type of emergency, assistance needed) and remains calm.

Student confidently and accurately simulates a 9-1-1 call, provides comprehensive information, answers questions effectively, and demonstrates an understanding of how to handle the situation until help arrives.
Student does not understand the importance of seeking help in emergency situations.
Student acknowledges that seeking help is sometimes necessary but cannot explain why.
Student recognizes the importance of seeking help in some situations but struggles to identify when it is most appropriate.
Student generally understands the importance of seeking help in emergency situations and can provide some examples.
Student clearly articulates the importance of seeking help in a variety of emergency situations, emphasizing safety and well-being.
Student comprehensively explains the importance of seeking help, providing specific examples and understanding the potential consequences of not seeking help.
